quoteLast: the Fusilier Brigade, with “C” Company, M.G. Battalion, moved off, the 7th Battalion on the right, the 8th on the left, and the 5th in support. Once again the right flank had the greater difficulty, and the progress of the 7th was slow.
title: The 42nd (East Lancashire) Division 1914-1918
author: Gibbon, Frederick P.
